byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and GRIFF PALMER
byline.contributor: Derek Willis contributed reporting.Derek Willis contributed reporting.

abstract: Federal Election Commission's campaign finance reports show that Pres Obama and the Democratic National Committee have spent close to $87 million in operating costs on his 2012 presidential campaign, about as much money as all Republican candidates combined have raised; gap in spending underscores facts easily lost amid the president's low approval ratings: that Obama brings unexpected financial resources to the campaign along with a team with a well-honed source of where and how to deploy money, people and technology.
snippet: Since the beginning of the year, President Obama and the Democratic National Committee have spent close to $87 million, which is as much as the Republicans have raised in total thus far.
lead_paragraph: Since the beginning of the year, President Obama and the Democratic National Committee have spent close to $87 million, which is as much as the Republicans have raised in total thus far.

headline.main: Big Cash Edge Powers Obama in Drive for ’12
headline.print_headline: Big Cash Edge Powers Obama In Drive for ’12
headline.seo: Big Cash Edge Powers Obama In Drive for 2012 Election
